body: Another interesting thing with this issue is that it shows different text in the background depending on whether Alacritty is in focus or not. Any clue where the weird background text could be coming from?

Same issue here, I recorded a screencast demoing the issue:

![alacritty-artifacts2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/147409/39093849-cc556e0c-462e-11e8-95f2-4ce1f1edcfda.gif)

(As you might notice, it's easily repeatable when hiding Alacritty via Cmd+H)

- Running: 1b7ffea136f55236729258ddbc6841282de91ae9
- Best reproduced on light (e.g. white) background
- `background_opacity: 0.85`
- Font: `Go Mono`
- `use_thin_strokes: false`
Same issue here on a MacBook Air running OS X 10.13.5.

Same issue on Macbook Pro 10.12.16

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/149870/43061704-132eef78-8e0b-11e8-965b-c9dbd3123e76.png)

You can't actually see the background effect in this screen shot - _only_ the ghosting effect.  I had just closed a split where the lighter part is.
Seeing the same issue here with `background_opacity: 0.5`, running on Macbook Pro 10.14.2 with Radeon Pro 560X graphics.
The problem is window shadow, I had the same problem with iTerm2 borderless patch and removing shadow fixed the issue. Would it be possible to add an option to remove window shadow?
Same issue here with `background_opacity: 0.3` on a 2017 Macbook Pro with Iris Pro graphics.

I'm having this issue with `background_opacity: 0.6` on a 2018 MacBook Pro (15).  

Is there no fix for this anywhere in the pipeline for the semi-near future?

issue.title: macOS - Window scaling has ghost text artifacts
issue.body:
Which operating system does the issue occur on?
macOS Mojave 10.14.5

Steps to reproduce:

1. Enable window trasparency
2. Resize an alacritty window, note the position of any existing text on the window at the maximum size scaled to by dragging the corner
3. Once the redraw happens, there are artifacts of the on-screen text as it appeared just before releasing the resize-drag. 


These seem to be a part of the window background and are unselectable. Other notable behaviours:

1. The artifacts are not visible if the window focus is lost. They are restored on restoring window focus
2. Resizing the window after this replaces the old artifacts with new ones.
3. These don't seem to exist in full-screen mode.


Related screenshot

![Screen Shot 2019-05-29 at 09 48 26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3663231/58562694-bed44b80-81f7-11e9-969f-c85d43d263a6.png)

body:
Re: #2490, these are the steps to reproduce on macOS Mojave 10.14.5
1. Enable window trasparency
2. Resize an alacritty window, note the position of any existing text on the window at the maximum size scaled to by dragging the corner
3. Once the redraw happens, there are artifacts of the on-screen text as it appeared just before releasing the resize-drag. 


These seem to be a part of the window background and are unselectable. Other notable behaviours:

1. The artifacts are not visible if the window focus is lost. They are restored on restoring window focus
2. Resizing the window after this replaces the old artifacts with new ones.
3. These don't seem to exist in full-screen mode.


Related screenshot

![Screen Shot 2019-05-29 at 09 48 26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3663231/58562694-bed44b80-81f7-11e9-969f-c85d43d263a6.png)

issue.title: Fix macOS OpenGL context resize ordering
macOS buttonless mode reverts to buttons after SimpleFullscreen
issue.body:
As title describes, going to SimpleFullscreen and back brings back buttons when in `buttonless` mode.

I only have CMD+F to SimpleFullscreen as follows :
```
key_bindings:
   - key: F
     mods: Command
     action: ToggleSimpleFullscreen
```

*Demo gif*:
![example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5755154/76687390-8857a800-6634-11ea-8b1a-2500386d7f89.gif)

I am no rust dev, but if you give me some pointers (pun intended), 
I am happy to research & fix :)

Btw this is very low severity. I generally use `transparent` mode. Accidently found out.

### System

OS: macOS
Version: `alacritty 0.4.2-rc1 (4883c41)`

### Logs
```
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.716928000] [INFO] Welcome to Alacritty
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.717112000] [INFO] Configuration loaded from "/Users/mert.akengin/.alacritty.yml"
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.790309000] [DEBUG] Estimated DPR: 2
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.790373000] [DEBUG] Estimated Cell Size: 12 x 24
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.790395000] [DEBUG] Estimated Dimensions: Some((976, 616))
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.832780000] [INFO] Device pixel ratio: 2
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.836187000] [INFO] Initializing glyph cache...
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.888137000] [INFO] ... finished initializing glyph cache in 0.051753044s
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.888282000] [INFO] Estimated DPR correctly, skipping resize
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.888326000] [INFO] Cell Size: 12 x 24
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.888346000] [INFO] Padding: 8 x 8
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.888371000] [INFO] Width: 976, Height: 616
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.888557000] [INFO] PTY Dimensions: Line(25) x Column(80)
[2020-03-14 20:32:52.893275000] [INFO] Initialisation complete
[2020-03-14 20:33:00.034193000] [DEBUG] New num_cols is 278 and num_lines is 86
[2020-03-14 20:33:00.037009000] [INFO] Width: 3360, Height: 2100
[2020-03-14 20:33:01.370070000] [DEBUG] New num_cols is 80 and num_lines is 25
[2020-03-14 20:33:01.370381000] [INFO] Width: 976, Height: 616
[2020-03-14 20:33:03.975715000] [INFO] Goodbye
```

body:
It seems like it's something required for transparent windows on macOS, since I found other links to use the `setHasShadow_(NO)` for transparent windows as well as using `setOpaque(NO)`.

I feel like managing such thing directly in alacritty based on config opacity value is a way to go.  winit already provides us with method to get `ns_window`, so it should be something simple as add a bunch of `cfg` and call proper method where we're updating/setting opacity. However it'll require someone with macOS to implement it(not me).

if anyone is interested in doing it, let me know.

> I feel like managing such thing directly in alacritty based on config opacity value is a way to go.

Is it? I don't think it makes a lot of sense to allow users to set transparency unless it actually works. So winit should set this if it isn't possible to make this work otherwise.
